intro: Securidaca polylopha, commonly known as the African senna, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height, characterized by its pinnately compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces elongated, woody pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. The botanical features of Securidaca polylopha make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
